attributes.action: introduce these six policies to ensure a better future for britian
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Create a countryside fit for wildlife
Farmers who look after their land in ways that help wildlife should be rewarded for doing so.  fund more work that restores and protects habitats that this threatened wildlife depends on.
. 
Safeguard our sealife
  create 40% of our seas as marine nature reserves that basking sharks, seahorses and puffins need to survive.
. 
Stop extinction
more funding towards our UK Overseas Territories, 32 of the species that we have responsibility for are in danger of being lost forever.
. 
Save tropical forests
 in Copenhagen later this year to secure (and take its fair share of funding) a global climate change agreement which must include keeping tropical forests intact – a great step towards saving some of the richest, and most threatened, places for wildlife in the world.
. 
 
. 
Inspire children through nature
If you experience wildlife first-hand, you’re more likely to love it, and if you love it, you’ll protect it.  create more opportunities for young people to enjoy nature. If we fail to act now, the wonderful moments with nature that enrich our lives today may become impossible for our children.
